title: Configuration
para:
If you opted to download the development checkout of &app;, the configure script will not be included. It can be created by running autogen.sh from the source root directory:
./autogen.sh
Note that there are some dependencies for autogen.

All the standard configure options are avaiable. In addition, &app; has two types of options: those which enable or disable features, and those which specify custom paths for development packages which aren't found during the default search. A complete list of all configuration options, including standard ones, can be seen by typing:
./configure --help
Read further for a more detailed explanation of &app;-specific options.

The syntax for running configure is as follows:
configure <options>
The example below shows the configure options which create the smallest working standalone version of &app;. In this example, configure is being run from the source root directory:
./configure --disable-debugger --disable-cygnal --disable-docbook --disable-plugin --enable-media=mad --enable-gui=sdl
